alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:31PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN...SOUTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL...WESTERN DE BACA AND CENTRAL GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM MDT... At 631 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northeast of Colonias to 6 miles northwest of Ramon. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Colonias, Yeso, Pastura, Puerto De Luna, Santa Rosa Lake State Park, Ramon, and Cuervo. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 257 and 298. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 162 and 194. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 278 and 316. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 59 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for central, southeastern, northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Eastern San Miguel County; Guadalupe County
